description: String of periods of finite sequences related to Poulet's Conjecture.
comments: Poulet's Conjecture states that for any integer n, the sequence f_0(n) = n, f_2k+1(n)=sigma(f_2k(n)), f_2k(n)=phi(f_2k-1(n)) (where sigma = A000203 and phi = A000010) is eventually periodic.
references: P. Poulet, Nouvelles suites arithmétiques, Sphinx vol. 2 (1932) pp. 53-54.
links: Leon Alaoglu and Pál Erdős, A conjecture in elementary number theory, Bull. Amer. Math. Soc. 50 (1944), 881-882.
author: Ursula Gagelmann (gagelmann(AT)altavista.net)
